intro: Epidendrum sarcostachyum, commonly known as the pink orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, showy inflorescences that bear numerous small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and deriving moisture and nutrients from the air and rain.
